content: project time ~4-6 hours materials us size h/ 5mm hook #4 medium weight yarn- 1 7oz skein is enough to make a 9 x 12 bag tapestry needle & scissors things to keep in mind you can use whatever hook size and yarn weight you like and i encourage you to experiment with that so you can familiarize yourself with gauge which is stitch size based on thickness of yarn size of hook and tightness of stitch because you will organically learn how to adjust a pattern to get your desired fit abbreviations chain- chain sts- stitches single_crochet- single_crochet slip_stitch- slip_stitch 2sc- work 2 single crochets into same stitch sc2 = 1 single_crochet into 2 individual stitches size 9 tall x 11 wide longer strap 12 5 & shorter strap 7 pattern you re essentially going to crochet a 11 x 3 cylinder for the base then work in the round to create the body of the bag make one long strap and one shorter strap then attach base worked in the round without turning create a slip knot and chain 33 1 2sc into second chain from hook single_crochet 30 sts 3sc into last stitch working on other side of chain single_crochet 30 sts single_crochet into first stitch where you put 2sc and slip_stitch to beginning 2 2sc first st 2sc next st single_crochet 30 sts 2sc next 3 sts single_crochet 30 sts 2sc slip_stitch to beginning 3 single_crochet 2 2sc twice single_crochet 30 across single_crochet 2 2sc x 3 single_crochet 30 across single_crochet 2 2sc slip_stitch to beginning 4 single_crochet 3 2sc twice single_crochet 30 across single_crochet 3 2sc x 3 single_crochet 30 across single_crochet 3 2sc slip_stitch to beginning 5 single_crochet in back loop only around slip_stitch to beginning body single_crochet around slip_stitch to beginning for 40 row straps 1 find halfway point on the left side and attach yarn work 12 single_crochet across 2 turn work then single_crochet 12 repeat til you have 56 row total 3 fasten_off leaving a tail to sew the strap to the body 4 find halfway point on the right side and attach yarn work 12 single_crochet across 5 turn work then single_crochet 12 repeat til you have 28 row total 6 fasten_off leaving a tail to sew the strap to the body 7 fold straps in half and line the ends up skipping 3 stitches then sew the end of each strap to the bag body 8 weave in ends and you re done
